Start a new hobby: If all sources of entertainment disappeared, you could use this opportunity to explore new hobbies that you have always wanted to try but never had the time or motivation to pursue. This could include anything from painting, writing, cooking, gardening, or playing a musical instrument.

Read more books: Reading is a great way to entertain yourself and expand your knowledge. You could choose a genre that interests you and start with a few books, gradually increasing the number of books you read.
Organize your home: A cluttered home can be overwhelming and distracting. By organizing your home, you can create a peaceful and relaxing environment that will help you stay focused on your goals.

Start a workout routine: Exercise is not only great for your physical health, but it can also help you clear your mind and reduce stress. You could try a new workout routine or sign up for a fitness class to keep yourself entertained.

Volunteer: Volunteering is a great way to give back to your community and help others. You could choose a cause that interests you and start volunteering regularly, which will not only help you stay focused and dedicated to your goals, but also give you a sense of purpose and fulfillment.
